an3.110:1.1: Seated to one side, the Buddha said to the householder Anāthapiṇḍika:
an3.110:1.2: “Householder, when the mind is amiss, bodily, verbal, and mental actions are also amiss.
an3.110:1.3: One whose bodily, verbal, and mental actions are amiss will not have a good death.
an3.110:1.4: Just as when a bungalow is  poorly roofed, the roof peak, rafters, and walls are also amiss,
an3.110:1.5: in the same way, when the mind is amiss, bodily, verbal, and mental actions are also amiss.
an3.110:1.6: One whose bodily, verbal, and mental actions are amiss will not have a good death.
an3.110:2.1: When the mind is not amiss, bodily, verbal, and mental actions are also not amiss.
an3.110:2.2: One whose bodily, verbal, and mental actions are not amiss will have a good death.
an3.110:2.3: Just as when a bungalow is well-roofed, the roof peak, rafters, and walls are also not amiss,
an3.110:2.4: in the same way, when the mind is not amiss, bodily, verbal, and mental actions are also not amiss.
an3.110:2.5: One whose bodily, verbal, and mental actions are not amiss will have a good death.”
